profileText: A Representative from Massachusetts; born in Winchendon, Worcester County, Mass., October 20, 1783; received a limited education and worked on a farm; taught school in Hingham, Mass., 1804-1814; became interested in the manufacture of cotton gins in Bridgewater; member of the State house of representatives 1824, 1825, 1827, and 1828; served in the State senate 1833 and 1834; again a member of the State house of representatives 1838-1842; delegate to the State constitutional convention in 1853; elected as a Whig to the Twenty-ninth and Thirtieth Congresses (March 4, 1845-March 3, 1849); engaged in agricultural pursuits; presidential elector on the Republican ticket in 1864; died in Bridgewater, Mass., August 3, 1882; interment in Mount Prospect Cemetery.

researchRecord.name: 1841, 1 page
researchRecord.description: A resolution signed by Hale and sent to Daniel Webster.

researchRecord.name: 1834, 3 pages.
researchRecord.description: A letter from Benjamin Willis to Hale discussing politics in Massachusetts, Missouri and Illinois, as well as Martin Van Buren's presidential prospects.

researchRecord.name: 1856, 1 item.
researchRecord.description: A letter from Abraham Lincoln to Hale concerning prospects for the presidential election in Illinois and Indiana.

researchRecord.name: 1800-1890, 2 feet.
researchRecord.description: Political correspondence (chiefly 1840-1850) and family correspondence. Finding aid in repository.
